function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Air recirculation can transport infectious contaminants through spaces, leading to the re-entry of virus particles into workstations.","Impact":"Increased risk of airborne transmission of contagious diseases within the built environment.","Mitigation":"Avoid central recirculation and use 100% outdoor fresh air in industries with ventilation systems during the COVID-19 pandemic.","Technologies":"High efficiency filters, local heating and cooling devices, ultraviolet irradiation.","People":"Employees, occupants, general public.","Owner":"Facility managers, building owners, government health authorities."},{"Description":"Failure to close recirculation dampers can lead to the distribution of airborne contaminants from one point to others connected to the same system.","Impact":"Widespread propagation of virus particles within the built environment.","Mitigation":"Implement strict closure of recirculation dampers and use high efficiency filters in recirculation units.","Technologies":"High efficiency filters, local heating and cooling devices, ultraviolet irradiation.","People":"Occupants, workers, general public.","Owner":"Facility managers, building owners, government health authorities."},{"Description":"Use of induction units and fan coils with local circulation may lead to the resuspension of virus particles.","Impact":"Increased risk of airborne transmission of contagious diseases in the built environment.","Mitigation":"Turn off induction units and fan coils with local circulation to prevent resuspension of virus particles.","Technologies":"High efficiency filters, local heating and cooling devices, ultraviolet irradiation.","People":"Employees, occupants, general public.","Owner":"Facility managers, building owners, government health authorities."},{"Description":"Insufficient outdoor airflow can contribute to the buildup of infectious contaminants in indoor spaces.","Impact":"Higher risk of indoor transmission of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Maximize outdoor airflow and consider the use of ultraviolet irradiation to reactivate the virus in recirculation air.","Technologies":"High efficiency filters, local heating and cooling devices, ultraviolet irradiation.","People":"Employees, occupants, general public.","Owner":"Facility managers, building owners, government health authorities."}]}
